alert.note: Alert for Spencer; Warrick (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 29 at 9:28PM EDT until June 29 at 10:15PM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: The National Weather Service in Paducah has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Warrick County in southwestern Indiana... Southwestern Spencer County in southwestern Indiana... Daviess County in northwestern Kentucky... Northeastern Henderson County in northwestern Kentucky... Northeastern McLean County in northwestern Kentucky... * Until 915 PM CDT. * At 828 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Eureka, or near Newburgh, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Owensboro, Boonville, Newburgh, Rockport, Livermore, Whitesville, Knottsville, St. Joseph, Masonville, Stanley, Eureka, Moseleyville, Pleasant Ridge and Hebbardsville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 165 between Mile Markers 60 and 70. Audubon Parkway between Mile Markers 5 and 23. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
